text:
Hey <@U02B0DKSRFZ>,

I just thought that It's possible because *Cookiebot* is not allowing a visitor to apply any significant action on the website before giving permissions to Cookiebot content. Try to connect with *Cookiebot support* to help implement an exception with Cookiebot content to show the HS form.
Thank you for you answer. Strange thing is that this happens suddenly and had worked before. I will contact Cookiebot support as well.
Yes, a bot mostly uses scripts to perform actions, and the behavior of the script may vary as per browser version, updates, etc.

Appreciate the help. Really what we're trying to do is make and test config changes in the sandbox account and then promote those changes to the live account. Is there any way to export and import HubSpot configuration?
I need help about deal API
I have create deal by API then add line item in deal but backend on edit deal page not show any item.

Hello everyone,
Does anyone know good lessons to learn how to develop a website with HubSpot ?
<@U01Q7K8R6TH> Can you check my screenshot and message.

Hey <@U02BXK8UZFB>,

Please check the deal details by fetching the deal once as if you are getting any associated Line item details in the response?
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/get_deal>
No, not that I'm aware of
Any one help me?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/line-items>
Thank you!

Hi devs,
I have built an app, currently not listed. I wan't to show it in workflow integrations i.e. it should be connected via "Connect an App" section (ref Image).
What should I do so that my app gets visible there.
Is there a way to dynamically show all the protected pages a given user has access to>

Hey <@U02BJBLGAV9>, currently the only way for your app to show up in that list is if it’s listed in the marketplace. If you’re just trying to test your action, there are a couple of options:
• If you are testing it in your developer portal, we’ll automatically include the action in the list of available actions
• If you are testing it in a different test portal, then you will need to manually install the app that the action is associated with in that test portal

Heads up, y'all!  There is a <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Now-Open-CMS-Hub-Starter-Ask-Me-Anything-August-16/m-p/479869/highlight/true#M24510|CMS AMA> going on in the community forums.  Your chance to ask the people who work on the product questions :grinning_face_with_star_eyes:
Svelte is pretty great within a module. If we could access data set via editable fields in javascript it would be a perfect solution

I just learned that if a property within a deal does not have a value, it will not return in the API call. Maybe it's the same for line items? If there are not line items, then you would not get a return.

Yes, the API wouldn't provide you the properties in response if they have empty or no value in HS, even if you add them in the request parameter. In-Line times, did you check that you created the products with the same identifier in the HS before pushing the line item properties?

When I copy an embed code for a form, there is a `region` param set (most of the time to ‘na1’). If I check the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options|docs>, I do not see this param mentioned. What is it for? Is it required? Thanks!
